source: Deciphering the 2012 Cholera Epidemic in Guinea
processing_notes: Source states: 'officially responsible for 7,350 suspected cases and 133 deaths' - interpreted as national epidemic data

column14: Source states: '4437 out of 7350 clinical cases (60%) were in Conakry' - interpreted as Conakry municipal cases

processing_notes: Source states: '25,358 cases and 952 deaths were recorded with a high case fatality rate of 3.8%' - interpreted as cumulative surveillance data
Source states: 'largest outbreak was in 1994 with more than 30,000 cases and 670 deaths' - interpreted as national epidemic data
Source states: '2004â€“2008, Guinea was struck by a succession of regional cholera outbreaks responsible for 17,638 reported cases and 786 deaths' - interpreted as multi-year cumulative data

source: Deciphering the 2012 Cholera Epidemic in Guinea
processing_notes: Source states: 'three-year lull period was observed from 2009 to 2011' - interpreted as validated zero-transmission period
Source confirms Guinea not listed among 33 countries reporting cholera cases to WHO during 2024-2025 - interpreted as surveillance-confirmed absence
Source states: 'Guinea reported 155 cases, including 12 deaths from August 6 to September 23 in N'zerekore region' - interpreted as regional outbreak data

column14: Source states: 'Guinea was affected by cholera in August 1970 as part of the seventh cholera pandemic' - interpreted as historical emergence milestone
Source states: '34% (4585) in Conakry, Guinea' from African Cholera Surveillance Network enhanced surveillance 2011-2013 - interpreted as Conakry surveillance data
